predicate.note: Frames file for 'clog' based on sentences in wsj. Verbnet entries 51.5, 9.8, 45.4.

roleset.name: style of dance
roleset.note: More usually as a process noun: "John enjoys clogging." Unlike many dance verbs, clog cannot take a cognate object. Thus, you can waltz a waltz, but cannot clog a clog.

roleset.name: obstruct a passage

example.name: just passage
example.text: At present, doctors can see how badly an artery is clogged [*-1] [*T*-3] only by inserting a thin catheter into the artery and injecting a fluid that makes the arteries visible on X-rays.

example.name: all args
example.text: John clogs Mary's drains with the hair he sheds.

roleset.note: It is VERY important to distinguish the agent and the clog!

roleset.name: obstruct a passage, phrasal

example.name: passive
example.text: The effect of Nixon era non-duck ducks was an economy clogged [*] up with regulations and distortions.

roleset.note: A more intensive version of clog.02
